content:
When I run validator_cli.jar today, I got "no core dependency or FHIR Version found in the Package definition". Here is the console output:

FHIR Validation tool Version 5.6.30 (Git# 7ee476a9b60d). Built 2022-02-07T21:02:15.271Z (67 hours old)
  Java:   11.0.8 from /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/adoptopenjdk-11.jdk/Contents/Home on x86_64 (64bit). 4096MB available
  Paths:  Current = /Users/yunweiw/GitHub/fhir-validator, Package Cache = /Users/yunweiw/.fhir/packages
  Params: practitioner.json -version 4.0.1 -ig http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core#3.1.1 -profile http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/StructureDefinition/us-core-practitioner
Loading
  Load FHIR v4.0 from hl7.fhir.r4.core#4.0.1 - 4575 resources (00:04.0414)
  Load hl7.terminology#3.0.0 - 3795 resources (00:01.0265)
  Terminology server http://tx.fhir.org - Version 2.0.12-SNAPSHOT (00:01.0132)
  Load http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core#3.1.1+  .. load IG from simplifier.core.r4#4.0.1
+  .. load IG from simplifier.core.r4.extensions#4.0.0
Exception in thread "main" org.hl7.fhir.exceptions.FHIRException: no core dependency or FHIR Version found in the Package definition
    at org.hl7.fhir.utilities.npm.NpmPackage.fhirVersion(NpmPackage.java:760)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.IgLoader.loadPackage(IgLoader.java:395)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.IgLoader.fetchByPackage(IgLoader.java:361)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.IgLoader.loadPackage(IgLoader.java:387)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.IgLoader.fetchByPackage(IgLoader.java:361)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.IgLoader.loadPackage(IgLoader.java:387)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.IgLoader.fetchByPackage(IgLoader.java:361)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.IgLoader.loadIgSource(IgLoader.java:173)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.IgLoader.loadIg(IgLoader.java:95)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.cli.services.ValidationService.initializeValidator(ValidationService.java:333)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.cli.services.ValidationService.initializeValidator(ValidationService.java:310)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.ValidatorCli.doValidation(ValidatorCli.java:238)
    at org.hl7.fhir.validation.ValidatorCli.main(ValidatorCli.java:164)

Why does validator need simplifier.core.r4?
I think the error is on the simplifier.core.r4.extesnion whose package.json does not have any dependencies nor fhir-version-list
Yunwei Wang has marked this topic as resolved.
Yunwei Wang has marked this topic as unresolved.

@Yunwei Wang simplifier.core.* are old mirror packages of the core FHIR specification. They should no longer be used. If you didn't specify them yourself, I assume one of the packages you are using has a dependency on that one still?
I can't figure out from the output which package that would be. Do you have more context on the dependencies in package.json or the IG resource from the project you are validating?

Thanks @Ward Weistra . I figured out the problem. I followed the example on the FHIR confluence page which uses url as -ig parameter value. I changed to the id of us core ig and it passed. Sorry for the false alarm.
Yunwei Wang has marked this topic as resolved.
